creator: kaplan@ma.tum.de
text:
With Apache 1.3.xx I used to put

   <!--#include virtual="/de_config.shtml" -->

somewhere in the header of my files to switch over to german
settings. This file contained definitions like

   <!--#config sizefmt="abbrev" -->
   <!--#config timefmt="%d.%m.%Y" -->

Somewhere in the footer I usually wrote

   <!--#echo var="LAST_MODIFIED"-->

and that worked fine.

Now I switched over to Apache 2.0.43 and the server ignores
my settings and uses the default timeformat. SSI is installed and
works. If I write the two instructions together like

   <!--#config timefmt="%d.%m.%Y" --> <!--#echo var="LAST_MODIFIED"-->

I get the german time format. But if the <!--#config timefmt="%d.%m.%Y" -->
appears I few lines earlier then it is ignored again!

The solution with <!--#include virtual="/de_config.shtml" --> doesn't work,
even if I put it directly in front of <!--#echo var="LAST_MODIFIED"-->

I couldn't find any hint in the docs, where to put the <!--#config ..-->-entries.

Any help is welcome!

Thanks in advance,

Michael Kaplan

creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org
text:
This works for me with HEAD of httpd-2.0.  Please try httpd-2.0.44 or newer.

Thanks for using Apache HTTP Server!
